Answers.MP Summary: run a command with substitute user and group ID
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_157220: compile a java program as different user
Top-3 Scripts:
au_157220: su $USER

USER=sameek
USERCMDS=/tmp/usercommands.$$
echo "JAVA_HOME=..." >>$USERCMDS
echo "PATH=\${JAVA_HOME}:\$PATH" >> $USERCMDS
echo "javac HelloWorld.java" >> $USERCMDS
chmod a+x $USERCMDS
su $USER -c $USERCMDS

Explanations about Options.-c: Pass command to the shell with the -c option.

so_27731599: gcc -fPIC -shared -o libmyfilter.so myfilter.c

Explanations about Options.-o:
Place output in file file. This applies to whatever sort of output is being produced,
 whether it be an executable file, an object file, an assembler file or preprocessed C
 code.
Explanations about Options.-Wall: turns on the following warning flags:
Explanations about Options.-shared:
Produce a shared object which can then be linked with other objects to form an
 executable. Not all systems support this option. For predictable results, you must
 also specify the same set of options used for compilation (-fpic, -fPIC, or model
 suboptions) when you specify this linker option.[1]
Explanations about Options.-c:
If any of these options is used, then the linker is not run, and object file names
 should not be used as arguments.
